channel.title: Sorry for spam posting :(

item.title: Sorry for spam posting :(
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Mini-Tutorials and List Folder”]Now first, get your model and extract it the the RAW folder in your client. Now add this:

case ####:
itemDef.name = "##";
itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
itemDef.modelID = ###;
itemDef.modelZoom = 848;
itemDef.modelRotationY = 267;
itemDef.modelRotationX = 138;
itemDef.modelOffset1 = 5;
itemDef.modelOffset2 = 0;
itemDef.anInt165 = -1;
itemDef.anInt200 = -1;
itemDef.anInt188 = -1;
itemDef.description = "#####".getBytes();
break;

Now, replace the:

= Your model ID you want it to have

= The name of your model

= The number your model had. Like the .dat file that you extracted to your RAW Folder,

it’s title.

= The description of the item when they press examine.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Sorry for spam posting :(
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

Hey guys, I know I just posted, sorry for reposting, but can somebody tell me how to make my own ints? I’m not sure what to put in these areas…

case 12334:
	itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
	itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear";
	itemDef.modelID = 12333; //drop model
	itemDef.anInt165 = 12334; //male wield model
	itemDef.anInt200 = 12334; //femArmModel
	itemDef.modelZoom = (idk what to put here);
	itemDef.modelRotationY = (idk what to put here);
	itemDef.aByte154 = (idk what to put here);
	itemDef.modelRotationX = (idk what to put here);
	itemDef.modelOffset1 = (idk what to put here);
	itemDef.modelOffset2 = (idk what to put here);
	itemDef.name = "Items name";
	itemDef.description = "Description of item".getBytes();
break;
